data.title: Decrypt the message
data.solution:
syllablesconsonants=input().split()
s=input()
for i in syllablesconsonants:s=s.translate(str.maketrans(i,i[::-1])).translate(str.maketrans(i.upper(),i.upper()[::-1]))
print(s)
data.statement:
Your objective is to decode a message.
A message has been coded in the following way:
the first vowel is replaced by the last, the second by the second last and so on: 
```a e i o u y
↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓
y u o i e a```


The first consonant is replaced by the last one, the second one by the second last one and the n-th one from the beginning by the n-th one from the end:
```b c d f g h j k l m p q r s t v w x y z
↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓
z y x w v t s r q p m l k j h g f d c b```

Thus the message "Apple" becomes "Yllpu".

If the letter of the coded message is a consonant then it remains a consonant and if a character of the coded message is not a letter, then it is left as is.

data.stubGenerator:

data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> a string [[syllablesconsonants]] containing vowels in alphabetical order separated from consonants in alphabetical order by a space.
<<Line 2:>> a  string [[s]]: the message to decode

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Your objective is to decode a message.
A message has been coded in the following way:
the first vowel is replaced by the last, the second by the second last and so on: 
a e i o u y
↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓
y u o i e a



The first consonant is replaced by the last one, the second one by the second last one and the n-th one from the beginning by the n-th one from the end:
b c d f g h j k l m p q r s t v w x y z
↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓
z y x w v t s r q p m l k j h g f d c b


Thus the message "Apple" becomes "Yllpu".

If the letter of the coded message is a consonant then it remains a consonant and if a character of the coded message is not a letter, then it is left as is.




   

      
Input

      
Line 1: a string syllablesconsonants containing vowels in alphabetical order separated from consonants in alphabetical order by a space.
Line 2: a  string s: the message to decode

   

   

      
Output

      
Line 1: the decoded message

   

   

      
Constraints

      

   

   

      
Example

      

         

            
Input

            
aeiouy bcdfghjklmnpqrstvwxz
Yllpu

         

         

            
Output

            
Apple
